net.gliblybits.bitsengine.core

Class BitsApp

  • java.lang.Object
    • Activity
      • net.gliblybits.bitsengine.core.BitsApp

  • public abstract class BitsApp
extends Activity
    BitsApp is the main activity class and the entry point for the android system.
    This abract class needs to be overridden by the game app itself.
    The BitsApp class will initialize the app settings. It will start the game thread and the
    render thread.

    Since:
    0.1 - Streak
    Version:
    0.1 - Streak
    Author:
    Marc Wiedenhoeft - GliblyBits

      • mSleepMode

        public static int mSleepMode

      • mViewportWidth

        public static int mViewportWidth
        Default: 1

        Width of the render surface.
        This value represents the width of the screen.
        Will be set by the engine itself!

      • mViewportHeight

        public static int mViewportHeight
        Default: 1

        Height of the render surface.
        This value represents the height of the screen.
        Will be set by the engine itself!

      • mGameWidth

        public static int mGameWidth
        Default: 800

        Width of the game itself.
        It is used to scale the game size up or down,
        according to the real screen resolution.

      • mGameHeight

        public static int mGameHeight
        Default: 480

        Height of the game itself.
        Is used to scale the game size up or down,
        according to the real screen resolution.

      • mScaleFactor

        public static float mScaleFactor
        Default: 1.0f

        Rate of scaling that occurs if the game renders itself.
        1.0f is a 100% scale and represents the original GameWidth/GameHeight values.
        A lower value of e.g. 0.9f will scale the original GameWidth/GameHeight to 90%.
        Vice versa for higher values.
        The engine will always keep the aspect ratio of the original GameWidth/GameHeight.
        This value will be set by the engine itself!

      • mSystemFont

        public static BitsFont mSystemFont
        Default: calibri.bff

        This is the BitsEngines default font.
        It is initialized by the engine itself at startup.

      • mWantTitleBar

        public static boolean mWantTitleBar
        Default: false

        Display androids app title bar?

      • mWantFullscreen

        public static boolean mWantFullscreen
        Default: true

        Display androids status bar?

      • mOrientationMode

        public static int mOrientationMode
        Default: ORIENTATION_BY_SENSOR

        Apps orientation mode.

      • mMaxImageCount

        public static int mMaxImageCount
        Default: 32

        The max. number of images that will be available in the image pool.
        This number sets the amount of images that can be loaded at the same time.
        This is important for the pooling to prevent the evil GC from running.

      • mMaxFontCount

        public static int mMaxFontCount

      • mMaxImageRenderables

        public static int mMaxImageRenderables
        Default: 64

        The max. number of images in the render queues (double buffering).
        In general this variable has to be the double size of 'MaxRenderablesOnScreen'.

        This might be confusing, so i will give a little example:
        If 'MaxRenderablesOnScreen' has been set to 128, there can be max.
        128 images on the screen. It doesn't matter if these images differ from each other or not,
        because a call to 'drawImage' will use one of the 128 image slots (BitsRenderable).
        So you may think we just need 128 of these image slots.
        But this is wrong since the engine uses a kind of double buffering.
        For example if the current frame uses the full 128 image slots, there will be no more image slots
        for the next frame.
        In our example the engine will swap 128 image slots from the game logic to the renderer and vice versa each frame (Pooling).

      • mMaxLineRenderables

        public static int mMaxLineRenderables

      • mMaxRectRenderables

        public static int mMaxRectRenderables

      • mMaxCircleRenderables

        public static int mMaxCircleRenderables

      • mMaxTouchPointer

        public static int mMaxTouchPointer
        Default: 2

        The maximum number of fingers that may lie at the same time on the display.

      • mMaxSoundsAtOnce

        public static int mMaxSoundsAtOnce
        Default: 10

        This value defines how many sound files may be played at the same time.

      • mUseSound

        public static boolean mUseSound
        Default: true

        This value defines the usage of sounds. If set to 'false', no sound files
        will be played, even if the app calls the play method of the SoundManager.
        The sound setting are independent from androids sound settings.

      • mUseMusic

        public static boolean mUseMusic
        Default: true

        This value defines the usage of music. If set to 'false', no music files
        will be played, even if the app calls the play method of the MusicManager. The music setting are independent from androids music/sound settings.

      • mMaxCyclesPerSecond

        public static int mMaxCyclesPerSecond
        Default: 60

        This values defines the cap of the frame rate.
        The app tries to reach this maximum, but won't go far beyond this value.

      • showFPS

        public static boolean showFPS
        Default: true

        If set to 'true' the app will render the frame rate in the upper left corner
        of the screen.

      • mClearColor

        public static float[] mClearColor
        Default: {0, 0, 0, 1.0}

        Use the static 'setClearColor' method to set the color easily.

        This array contains the float color values (red, green, blue, alpha) for the
        OpenGL ES clearing method.
        The screen will be filled with this color every frame.
